storyTitle: As HR Specialist, I want to generate attendance reports to track employee presence and absences

testCases.title: Validate attendance report generation with valid filters
preconditions: User is logged in with HR Specialist role credentials
Attendance tracking system database contains test data for multiple employees
Test data includes attendance records for at least the last 30 days
User has active network connection to the system

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options including date range, employee selector, and department selector visible

steps.action: Select a valid date range (e.g., last 7 days) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range is accepted and displayed in the filter field without validation errors

steps.action: Select a specific department from the department dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Department filter is applied and displayed correctly in the filter section

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to request report generation
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a loading indicator while generating the report

steps.action: Wait for report generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report is generated within 15 seconds and displayed on screen with correct data including employee names, dates, presence status, absences, and late arrivals matching the selected filters

steps.action: Verify the report data matches the applied filters
steps.expectedResult: All displayed records fall within the selected date range and department, with accurate attendance data for each employee

postconditions: Attendance report remains displayed on screen for review
Filter selections remain active for subsequent report generations
System logs the report generation activity

testCases.title: Verify export functionality for attendance reports
preconditions: User is logged in with HR Specialist role credentials
Attendance reporting module is accessible
Test data exists in the attendance database
Browser download settings allow automatic file downloads
User has write permissions to the default download folder

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reporting module
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options

steps.action: Select a date range of last 30 days and a specific department filter
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied successfully without errors

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button to generate attendance report with the applied filters
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated and displayed on screen with attendance data including employee names, dates, presence, absences, and tardiness information

steps.action: Click the 'Export to CSV' button
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is downloaded to the default download folder with a filename containing timestamp and report type

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file using a spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and contains all report data with correct column headers, employee information, dates, and attendance status matching the on-screen report

steps.action: Return to the attendance report screen and click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is downloaded to the default download folder with a filename containing timestamp and report type

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully with correct formatting including company header, report title, filter parameters, table structure, and all attendance data matching the on-screen report

postconditions: Two files (CSV and PDF) are saved in the download folder
Original report remains displayed on screen
Export activity is logged in the system audit trail

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot access attendance reports
preconditions: Test user account exists with non-HR role (e.g., Employee or Manager role)
Attendance reporting module exists in the system
API endpoint /api/reports/attendance is configured with role-based access control
User is not currently logged in

steps.action: Navigate to the login page and enter credentials for a non-HR user (e.g., regular employee account)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged into the system with non-HR role

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the attendance reporting module via the main menu or navigation
steps.expectedResult: Attendance reporting module option is not visible in the navigation menu, or access is denied with an appropriate error message stating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Attempt to access the attendance reporting module directly by entering the URL in the browser
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to an access denied page or displays an error message indicating the user does not have permission to access this resource

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and attempt to access the API endpoint directly by sending a GET request to /api/reports/attendance
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden status code with an error message indicating access is restricted to authorized HR specialist roles only

steps.action: Verify the response body contains appropriate security error message
steps.expectedResult: Response body contains error message such as 'Access denied: Insufficient permissions' or 'Unauthorized access to attendance reports'

postconditions: Non-HR user remains logged in but cannot access attendance reports
Security violation attempt is logged in the system audit trail
No attendance data is exposed to the unauthorized user

storyTitle: As HR Specialist, I want attendance reports to highlight tardiness for compliance monitoring

testCases.title: Validate tardiness detection in attendance reports
preconditions: User is logged in with HR Specialist role credentials
Attendance database contains test records with tardiness data (employees who arrived late)
Tardiness threshold is configured in the system (e.g., 15 minutes after scheduled start time)
Test data includes at least 5 employees with tardiness occurrences in the last 30 days
Attendance reporting module is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with filter options and report generation controls

steps.action: Select a date range that includes known tardiness occurrences (e.g., last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter is applied successfully without validation errors

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button to generate attendance report with tardiness data
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and generates the attendance report within 15 seconds

steps.action: Review the generated report for tardiness highlights
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed with tardiness occurrences clearly highlighted using visual indicators such as color coding (e.g., yellow or orange), icons, or bold text for late arrivals

steps.action: Verify the accuracy of tardiness detection by comparing highlighted entries with actual arrival timestamps
steps.expectedResult: All employees who arrived after the tardiness threshold are correctly flagged and highlighted, and employees who arrived on time are not flagged

steps.action: Select a specific employee from the employee filter dropdown who has known tardiness records
steps.expectedResult: Employee filter is applied successfully

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' to filter the report by the selected employee with tardiness
steps.expectedResult: Filtered report is generated showing only attendance records for the selected employee

steps.action: Verify the filtered report displays tardiness information for the selected employee
steps.expectedResult: Filtered report shows all tardiness occurrences for the selected employee with correct dates, arrival times, and tardiness highlights matching the employee's actual attendance records

postconditions: Attendance report with tardiness highlights remains displayed on screen
Filter selections remain active for subsequent operations
Report generation activity is logged in the system

testCases.title: Verify export of attendance reports with tardiness highlights
preconditions: User is logged in with HR Specialist role credentials
Attendance database contains records with tardiness occurrences
Attendance reporting module is accessible
Browser download settings allow automatic file downloads
PDF reader application is installed on the test machine

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reporting module
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report UI is displayed with available filter options

steps.action: Select a date range that includes employees with tardiness records (e.g., last 14 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter is applied successfully

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button to generate attendance report with tardiness highlights
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated and displayed on screen with tardiness occurrences visually highlighted using color coding or special formatting

steps.action: Review the on-screen report to identify tardiness highlights and note specific examples
steps.expectedResult: Report displays with clear visual indicators for tardiness including highlighted rows or cells for late arrivals

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button to export the report
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and downloaded to the default download folder with a descriptive filename including timestamp

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully displaying the attendance report with professional formatting

steps.action: Verify that tardiness highlights are preserved in the PDF export
steps.expectedResult: PDF includes tardiness highlights using visual indicators such as colored text, highlighted cells, or special symbols/icons that clearly distinguish late arrivals from on-time attendance

steps.action: Compare the PDF content with the on-screen report to ensure data accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All tardiness occurrences shown in the on-screen report are accurately represented in the PDF with consistent highlighting, and all employee names, dates, and attendance data match exactly

postconditions: PDF file with tardiness highlights is saved in the download folder
Original report remains displayed on screen
Export activity is logged in the system audit trail
PDF file is ready for compliance monitoring and archival purposes

storyTitle: As HR Specialist, I want to export attendance reports in multiple formats to support diverse analysis needs

testCases.title: Validate export of attendance reports in CSV format
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Specialist with valid credentials
User has permission to access attendance reports
Attendance data exists in the system for the selected period
Browser allows file downloads
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reports section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance reports page loads successfully with report generation options visible

steps.action: Select date range for the attendance report (e.g., last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and displayed in the date picker fields

steps.action: Select department or employee filters if applicable
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied and displayed in the filter section

steps.action: Click on 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report is generated and displayed on screen with employee names, dates, attendance status, and other relevant columns

steps.action: Locate and click on the 'Export' button or dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears showing CSV, PDF, and Excel format options

steps.action: Select 'CSV' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: CSV export process initiates and file download begins within 10 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file using a spreadsheet application or text editor
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully with all attendance data correctly formatted, including headers, employee information, dates, and attendance status matching the displayed report

steps.action: Verify data integrity by comparing sample records from the CSV with the on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: All data points match exactly between the CSV file and the displayed report with no missing or corrupted data

postconditions: CSV file is successfully downloaded to the user's default download location
File contains complete and accurate attendance data
Original report remains displayed on screen
System logs the export activity
User can perform additional exports if needed

testCases.title: Validate export of attendance reports in Excel format
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Specialist with valid credentials
User has permission to access and export attendance reports
Attendance data exists in the system for the selected period
Browser allows file downloads
Microsoft Excel or compatible spreadsheet application is available to open the file
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reports section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Attendance reports page loads successfully with all report generation controls visible

steps.action: Select date range for the attendance report (e.g., quarterly report)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and displayed correctly in the date picker fields

steps.action: Configure any additional filters such as department, location, or employee status
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied and displayed in the active filters section

steps.action: Click on 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Attendance report is generated and displayed on screen with complete data including employee details, attendance records, leave information, and summary statistics

steps.action: Locate and click on the 'Export' button or dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears showing CSV, PDF, and Excel format options clearly labeled

steps.action: Select 'Excel' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: Excel export process initiates and file download begins within 10 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file using Microsoft Excel or compatible application
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully without errors or corruption warnings

steps.action: Verify the Excel file structure including worksheets, headers, and data organization
steps.expectedResult: Excel file contains properly formatted worksheets with clear headers, appropriate column widths, and organized data structure

steps.action: Check data accuracy by comparing sample records from the Excel file with the on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: All data points including employee names, dates, attendance status, hours worked, and leave records match exactly between the Excel file and the displayed report

steps.action: Verify that Excel-specific features are functional such as sortable columns, filterable data, and formula compatibility
steps.expectedResult: Excel file supports standard spreadsheet operations including sorting, filtering, and calculations without errors

postconditions: Excel file is successfully downloaded to the user's default download location
File contains complete and accurate attendance data in proper Excel format
Data is structured for easy analysis and manipulation
Original report remains displayed on screen
System logs the export activity with user details and timestamp
File can be opened and edited in Excel or compatible applications
